author: m.kalinin
content:
A simplification in the validator activation flow enabled by deposit queue finalization, TL;DR: get rid of `activation_eligibility_epoch` usage
PTAL, https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/pull/3983

author: jgm
content: Any reason not to set the activation eligibility epoch to the epoch where the relevant deposit queue is finalized? Or to be the same as the activation epoch? Otherwise the definitions at https://hackmd.io/ofFJ5gOmQpu1jjHilHbdQQ will need to change, and they are used in various places.

author: m.kalinin
content:
Thanks for sharing the doc!
`pending_initialized` condition will need to be changed to `validator.activation_epoch == FAR_FUTURE_EPOCH` and `pending_queued` to `validator.activation_epoch > current_epoch`.

The reason of not using the elgibility epoch is that it becomes redundant. If we want it to still be set then I think it is just better to make no changes

author: jgm
content: I agree that it is redundant with your change, but setting it retains backwards-compatibility so avoids immediate  issues. It could then be deprecated in Electra and use slowly removed downstream, eventually freeing up a slot in the validator struct (exciting!)

author: m.kalinin
content: So, you suggest to keep it updated but not used for activation, right? And announce deprecation

author: jgm
content: If the field is not useful internally any more, that seems a reasonable approach, yes.
